title: Leavesden film studios no 'muggles' as profits soar
text:
Revenue at Leavesden studios – home of the Harry Potter series – accelerated 9pc to a record £158.1m last year driven by a string of blockbusters shot there including Hobbs & Shaw, latest film in The Fast and the Furious franchise.

The car chase extravaganza stars Dwayne Johnson and Jason Statham as security services agents on the trail of a terrorist (Idris Elba).

It was one of a growing number of Hollywood productions attracted to Britain by tax breaks which allow studios to claim back up to 25pc of their spending in the country provided that it comes to at least 10pc of the total.

This month the Office for National Statistics reported that between June and August, booming TV and film production...
description: Revenue at Leavesden studios – home of the Harry Potter series – accelerated 9pc to a record £158.
